reviews.review_msg: He looked the other way when there was obvious cheating going on during the midterm (with class average 87%) and always came in late for lectures.  I had to wait 30 minutes while he spoke to a master's student during his office hour and told me to just email him because he needed to leave. Macroeconomics was my favourite until I took Ken's class.
Class is pretty dull, his lectures are a snoozer. Studying lecture notes and reading text when necessary is all you need. Final was just a mix of questions from past finals which he posts online

Kasa is the best prof as I know. His presentation is according to the book but add something else, like IS-LM curve. I failed in midterm, but finally passed this course.  Practices questions post online can be helpful, and read textbook& notes before classes, you will feel better during the 2hrs lecture and exams.
i never went to class since its so dull, he is a good teacher but his class is more dull than watching MASH. His exams are very fair and he is a nice guy.
holy snooze fest batman.
Failed hard for the midterm, but eventually passed the course in the end. he likes graphs
HE'S LAZY!!! all the answers for his assignments are somewhere online. he does it for his other courses too. you just got to google it. he's knowledgable but very boring.

Lecture contents are very easy and concise than the textbook. Exams are too easy but not sure why class average is only 46%. Exams are linked to assignments/previous exams and assignments. The only and serious drawback is that theclass is too boring. Spend 10 mins reading the notes at home is better than attending 2hour lecture+2hour tut in sum

Nice guy, and really helpful; however the course material is hard unless your math is super good. Do not be fooled, just because he has a smiley, does not mean he's an easy proff. Our class hit a record low on the midterm average 46%. Enough said, but nice guy though~

not recommended. not interesting at all and no interested in student's progress. there are better choices for profs. just talks talks talks in class. would sometimes gives 5 min break 20 min b4 he ends class. very weird

he is LAZY and BORING!!! Not very helpful. he's in his own little world. mediocre prof for the course. could find better. BUT LAZY BORING and not very helpful. TA kenneth lam is very helpful and good!!!
It was like a dream. 2 hour lecture with NO break. 1/2 of student sleeping. did horrible on MT. managed a B in the end. no books necessary. detailed notes, study notes and will be okay!
do all the questions on his website,you'll be fine!

I am a very lazy student. I hart to read textbook. He is the prof who can make you think critically and he doesn't rely the textbook. Most profs in this course only tells you how to do those calculus. But Dr. Kasa is smart. I learned a lot from him. His lectures are a bit hard. But exams are not that bad. I will keep taking his classes in future.

He's American...and his lecture are majorly boring!!!!!!!decent class but with lots, lots, lots lots lots lots of noteS! I don't even know how to study for the finals...way to much info...i guess thats why its a 5 credit course! 2 courses in 1!!!!!

I Agree with you guys, he's very nice and really want to help student with their study,not like some prof who doesn't care about their student, we should have more prof like him, took 305 and 345 with him, get a very decent grade.Notes are helpful,exams and assignments are fair...good Prof...
...zzz.zzz...
Lecture material was too difficulty for students who don't preview it. Go to the tutorial all the time, and try the past exam by your own.
Prof Xiaowen was great, always answered emails and helped me a lot outside class.  Make sure to go to the class, since some materials in the final is only covered in the lecture but not textbook.

Great Prof. Took during fall 2023 term and found the class pretty easy. There were 3 midterms and no "final" and only the top 2 midterms counted for the final grade. Also had 2 assignments which also counted for the final grade. Didn't really study that much and got an A. Luba was very helpful during office hours. Take with luba if possible.
Great Prof

Luba is a very smart professor and clearly passionate. However, she's absolutely horrible at teaching. Definitely the hardest economics course I've taken. 
She spent only one hour teaching us how to code using Dynare in Matlab. Doesn't post online slides/notes.
It felt like her class is only for those who are naturally on the smarter side.

The content is extremely difficult when compared to what this course is supposed to offer. Lecture feels like a tutorial as she only does 1 practice problem with no theory. No lectures posted, assumes you have a strong understanding of coding. Avoid at all costs, there is no structure to the course. She is smart but that does not mean you can teach

Difficulty was cranked to 11 due to 4 reasons:
1. No posted handwritten notes or regular slides with complex graphs and theory.
2. Latter half of the course entirely based on her notes with 0 textbook support
3. How she teaches dynare code for assignments is not helpful AT ALL
4. Only 3 exams and 2 assignments, 1 exam omit allowed

AVOID LUBA!!!

Honestly, could not have asked for a better prof for the course. She delivers not just the theoretical clearly, but also makes you apply it! It's unusual in a 305 course to be able to apply it. Luba encourages participation and creative questions. She's also incredibly knowledgeable!
Her midterm is totally and completely indifferent to the sample exercises. She said the code part will not appear in the final exam but it finally did appear in the final exam.

Luba is awesome. Great lecturer, super responsive to questions whenever. Does well explaining the intuition behind the economic concepts in this class. Never had any doubts about what she was lecturing. She's clearly enthusiastic about macroeconomics, which really helps. Tests are hard but everything on them is taught in class or requires intuition

Luba makes lectures interesting,  gives you comprehensive notes to study from and encourages students to engage in conversation which is unusual and inspiring. Midterms and the grading is fair. She really wants you to learn the concepts and gain a better overall understanding of macroeconomy. Made us watch a documentary in class which was cool!
She used to be an easy prob but not anymore... She can not give a clearly explanation and exam were really hard.. No calculate and all writing questions!
Very helpful and straight forward, be prepared to write 1000 words of notes every class. Do not need text book, everything u need is study all the nasty hand written notes. good prof.
Study lecture notes/tutorial assignments, didn't read the textbook (which she gives online). Take 305 with her! Will not regret it one bit.
Best prof I ever take!
Very good and clear. Exams are fair enough as long as you go to the lecture and review all her lecture notes. Good Econ prof in sfu !

Best econ prof at SFU. Lectures are clear and organized, she goes over many examples so you can understand the material clearly. Exams were fair, some tricky parts but she tells you what she expects during her lectures. Just go to class, video questions on exams are easy free marks.
Great prof, wants you to actually learn and willing to help! Fair exams, requires intuition, very knowledgeable and interested in material.

Great prof.  Clear.  Exams and midterm fair.  Ended up with a B+.  Don't buy the Abel textbook as she uses only the Andolfotto textbook.   Exams and midterm based solely on her lecture notess and tutorials.  Recommend!
very good Pro.Exams are easy! choose her!

Very helpful with a positive attitude. Clear note yet you have to show up for lecture. No notes posted on webct.  Exams are fair yet you really have to study for it. Overall she is a great professor for her first time teaching.
Great prof.  I think it was her first time, but she was very good.  Clear notes, exams are fair.  Nice personality, always smiles.   One of the few good Econ profs at SFU
Easiest A ever!!!! Super nice professor!! Highly recommended!!

Worst prof i had in SFU, All his notes are from txt book package he bought. No one ever shows up to his classes. His exams are pretty easy. 15 mc 5 written. MEMEORIZE ALL FORMULAs if you wanna do well in his class. Im supprise they haven't kicked him out of sfu yet.

Eastern European accent, so may be hard for some people to understand. Overall it was kind of hard to follow his lectures, even though the book explained everything very well. He posts his powerpoints, but only after class - kind of inconvenient.  All in all - I'd give him 3 out of 5.
nice

One of the best ECON profs in SFU, he provides everything you need to succeed in the course. Lots of reading though, but most of them are fun to read. The exams are easy if you practice a lot. Most of the questions are similar compared to past exams. His lecture is enjoyable. But I guess most of the students do not practice so the average was low.

He explains concepts much better than most econ profs, and he provides copies of previous years exams, which is quite helpful, however the exams are incredibly difficult. Class averages are low, largely due to the amount of "trick" questions in the multiple choice section (about 1/3rd of the exam). If you want a good grade you need to study tonnes.
Take ECON305 with Lucas and you'll never regret if you do all the past exams! Favourite PROF in upper-division courses! Thank you Lucas!

Hey guys, if you are looking for the best 305 in SFU, it's Lucas! Although the final exam is considerably hard (at least for me, I got 35/60 and idk about the average), he is definitely a fair grader! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Vielen Dank, Herr Lucas, wenn Sie meinen Kommentar sehen

Hilarious final exam, not sure the average yet but many of my friends are frustrated the way I do too since we all wanted to boost our grades due to the failure on midterm2, well now we are kinda screwed. Have fun guys.

He posted all old exams including midterms and finals, two midterms and one final, but only the highest two are accounted. Sounds great but you never know what questions will be on final. Totally new questions, so what's the point of posting all old exams that are fully inconsistent? His final literally makes me depressed. thx.

The readings and lectures were interesting. He provides you with everything you need to succeed. It's simply up to whether or not you use it. I did find him a little condescending when I went for help which put me off from going to his office hours again. His exams are quite difficult but passable if you understand a majority of the course content.

Lucas is a really good prof, his slides are helpful and really good to review after going through the textbook. The exams are difficult though, you need to remember basically everything.. just in case. But he gives out past exams which can be really helpful! Your TA can make or break this course, unless youre comfortable asking Lucas questions!!

Lucas is a great prof. His midterms and finals are HARD so study HARDER and you will do well. He goes over a lot of material and rewards those who understand the material's concepts. You can't rely on your ability to work with math. His lectures are very well done but not mandatory so go but don't freak out about missing some.

Lucas is a great prof for macro if you want someone that will not hold your hand, but give you enough material to develop your interest in the subject. Midterms/Finals are not easy - but do the practice q's and you should leave w a solid mark. There are weekly assignments/readings, and tutorials are optional.

The two midterms were fair but the final was crazy hard, the average was barely 50%. I failed the final but I ended up walking out with a C+ cause of the curve. His practice exams that are posted online which honestly helped a lot!! I did good on the midterms but for the final definitely study more and you'll be fine!

He's a gentleman and very professional. Helpful, caring, lectures are clear, concise and interesting. He covers a lot in the class, so keep on top of your readings, and pay attention. Will call you out if you use your cellphone in his class, so don't do it.
Best Econ prof ever!

There is a reason for his 4.5 rating here. Teaching is very clear with detailed notes. Knowledgeable and easy-going, most importantly, he is fair. As someone mentioned below, he released extra past exams to make it fair. Assignments are easy to get full marks and exams are ok if you study past exams (helps a lot). Hope he'll teach another course.

Lucas is the best professor I've ever taken. He is always happy to give help and rely emails, even it's 11pm the day before the exam. A fair grader, when he knows someone is selling his past exams, and he send this exam to all of us. Would take him again if I can.
Great prof.

His teaching is OK but the class was very boring and simplistic. ECON 201 made me think that econ would get more mathematical but this course didn't do that at all. Maybe it's not his fault (undergrad econ might not need heavy math). It's the reason I'm transferring out of econ. A difficult 2nd MT and final made an easy curve . Finished with an A+.

Lucas is a great prof, I would highly recommend him. The class is one that requires reading, work and practice; despite this, Lucas clarifies concepts and delivers the large amount of material in a manageable way. Excellent clarification and helpfulness. Would be better if an answer key to the problem sets was available and more practice questions.

I had a positive experience in his class this semester. The course material is somewhat challenging and his lectures are very clear and concise when it comes to explaining the material. He has a positive attitude and punches a little bit of quirky humour into his lectures every once in a while. He is an all round goof prof.

I would say he's one of the nicest prof i have met in SFU. He always replies his emails. He's very helpful and he can teach, He's encouraging and inspiring. But he might surprise you in the exams.  Since he asked us for opinions in the last lecture Hmm if there was official answer keys posted for our assignments, that would be great.

Lucas is probably one of the best Econ profs you will ever get. Clear lecture notes and relevant readings (though he assigns a fair bit) that are tied to the assignments really help for the exam. He is very helpful if you have questions, so even if you missed a class for some reason, do ask him for help.

Awesome prof. Down to earth. Lecture notes are really clear. Assigns a lot of readings but they're mostly supplementary and not required to do well. Focus on class notes.  Has a few endearing quirks, especially in regards to his grammar.
Best prof ever in SFU, if you find his course, don't hesitate to take it!

David is the most amazing prof at SFU. He has an art of explaining theory in the simplest form ever. Be respectful when you come to class, be on time, pay attention, do not sit on your phone during lecture, its rude! You will get a lot out of this class if you listen, he is so knowledgeable! Has a great sense of humour, best class I ever took!
He did not test students understanding of this course. What students should do is only to remember past papers. It is a joke. Class notes are in mess. Learned nothing from this course.

For me, this course is a disaster. Test two is exactly the same as the past paper which he sent to us by email. Average grade is above 90. I spent a lot of time reviewing course materials but I missed the email. So unhappy and ready to retake the course. Take my money.

Extremely easy to get good grades if you spend some time reading the textbook and especially the midterms from previous years because he often asks the same questions, word for word. Overall a great prof and enjoyable course.

One of the great professors i had so far. He's so knowledgeable and clear about stuff! He doesn't go over everything so self-study are needed. GO TO TUTORIALS!! though TAs dont take attendance but they are super helpful. Study and u'll ace.
Nice guy. easy final
Extremely knowledgeable prof with a great sense a humor... Hey What's not to love??
like his teaching! love his note! concentrate on his lecture and note, then you will be fine. Fair exam.
Poor teaching skills
I liked the way the class was structured! It was interesting and not too hard!

Great prof, fair tests. bottom line is econ 305 summer 11 was super easy, many midterm questions appeared on final. how can you complain about that???? some of you thought the class was too easy, well get over yourself and go to grad school then. others thought it was too hard, in that case take general studies.
good teacher, interesting course,  fair midterms, unfair final (same questions than in the midterms) :S

David was making fun of his students, he usually made silly jokes that reflects his personality, but at the end of his course all his students was making fun of him. Especially after his final who was a mixed questions of midterms 1&2. TIT for TAT strategy.

Very bad professor and book. He taught us ABC model, at the first glance I thought I was in the kindergarten class when I first learned ABC. He must call that model Ante-Romanian Model where it was used first. We are in 21-st century and he tested us on Pre-History model. Useless Prof)
I regret to take this course with this "Prof". From the beginning I thought I was in the wrong course because he taught us Micro more than Macro with his irrelevant and ridiculous book.

His course was waste of effort, what he taught us in class never appears in the midterms, his silly questions reflects his teaching abilities and skills, he examined us twice on what is the difference between (Equivalent) and (Equal. I do not recommend him at all

His course is just pure reading and memorizing, can only rely on his slides. Attendance is not mandatory, more than half of the class missing after the first midterm. But do recommend taking his course for easy grade.

What can say David he is not a professor at all. Econ 305 was waste of time and effort. No real final,his midterms questions reflects high school economics. He has to teach at high school & not at Univ. wake up SFU economics department. He is vice president at FED St Louis for this reason USA still suffer from the greatest recession, wake up FED

Notes: too simple, making you feel clueless; Textbook: using complicated methods to explain so simple idea; Lecture: have no idea why some laugh at his not-funny-at-all jokes; Midterms: test you on something irrelevant to this course; Final exam: copy of midterm 1&2, making it a memorizing history course. WASTE of TIME. Nothing Learned.

One word to describe this prof: "ridiculous". He is not good at explaining theories. Lecture slides and his own textbook are irrelevant. His exam is just copied and pasted those midterm questions (perhaps super lazy? He didn't even show up in the exam. on vacation?). Even I got a B+ in this course, I am still regret because I didn't learn much.

D. Andolfatto is one of the worst professors in the world. His book is useless and so are his lectures. you pass the course if you are good in memorization, and for advanced courses the students will suffer. He did not bother himself to put a final what he did was a combination of midterms questions with the same type error. It is a waste of time
He is the best prof I've ever seen! He is awesome! Thanks David!
Cant grade. Blames students for his poor marking skills.
No Comments
Great Prof, really learned a lot from him. Very clear. Would recommend him to anyone who wants to really learn

as i heard a prof and some TAs said:"David's 1 of the future superstars of economics at sfu!" he's simply brilliant.he uses his own techniques and his own textbook which give him lots of control over materials to be covered..going to class's like going to a meeting as u can really learn along w/ him
tough course

Very clear and organized prof! Textbook was purchased online which saved me a lot of $. Well just attend all the lectures and pay attention, then you'll be very clear about the materials. Easy midterms + exams. Expected A~
Just read his notes and past midterm questions and you will do just fine! I stinked in macro, but I got an A+ because of him. Definitely one of the best Econ Prof in SFU.
No Comments
No Comments

If you want to learn Macro, then don't take his course, because you will not learn much useful stuff but know more Micro.  Also, this prof can be very impatient with students when he is not in good mood.
No Comments
If your goal is to get an A, then take it with him, but you cannot expect to really learn anything from him. Indeed, he is probably the best looking prof in the economics department, but so what?
if you have to take this class... take his class! if you study... you will get an A it's that simple... :)
attractive, charming! His class notes are very clear! and u only need to study his notes for exams!
handsome and attractive...clear lecture...take it u won't regret...superman...
Very good teacher...  and tests are very easy too (however that makes the average very high :( )... do not trust other negative comments!!!
Good prof, very clear and organized notes...no need to read the text.  Also, very hot!
Exams are highly related to lecture.  Go to ur lecture and u can't get less than a C range.  Do a bit of work an A will not be a dream.
Very organize with his lecture notes, exams are comprehensive (you have to understand the materials).  In addition, I find him very attractive, he looks like Superman :)
Best class notes ever!! Tests can be hard, some math can be tricky if your algebra is rusty.  Overall you will learn alot and gain knowledge, isnt that why you are in school?
No Comments
Good notes. Makes things a lot easier and understandable. Covers quite a bit, but could go a bit faster and explain more complex models. Overall, a good prof!!
He was a really good prof and made his class very enjoyable
No Comments
Test are hard but he curves
No Comments
Not easy, but a good prof.
No Comments
No Comments
best class notes ever

Avg prof. Tends to go off on tangents & lose sight of the material.Uses lot of jargon which can be confusing for some not well versed in macro issues. U find urself losing focus as he jumps from one topic to the nxt & leaves u with confused mishmash of things u try to make sense of. Avoid if u prefer to have organization and structure to lectures.

Does a good job of keeping macroeconomics interesting. His somewhat random tangents are nice as they usually include real life examples of topics and it also gives a break from the lecture material which is pretty hard to take it all in during lecture (especially at 8:30am). Overall one of the best ECON profs at SFU, he gets my seal of approval.

i donno abt how he teaches 291 but in 305 i found his lectures rather interesting. he explains things clearly and puts good arguments behind his reasoning (but i rarely came to class b/c it was 8:30am) his assignments are harder than his exams (which is good for learning) but thankfully the TA marked leniently. keep up w/ textbook reading tho.

Good hearted. On the exam he lets you survive. But speaks too fast. You can hardly record it. Knowledge is not thorough. But will not agree that he for instance does not understand Hamiltonians himself. Jumps around between the topics, does not hold steady focus.
1.sure he's pasionate for macroeconomics.             2.lots of notes.        3.goes too detailed(out of question) when explaining things. 4. boring lecture, non-stop talking and mono tone.

do not rely on lecture notes...also he explains things very detailed sometimes its not clear. anyhow, interesting subject and he is very passionate about it. read the textbook 4 times and you are set for the final.
Super good prof. Knows what he's talking about and very approachable. He's got a good sense of humor too!

The course is hard without a doubt. Its hard to do well in a topic you aren't interested in and that's exactly why this guy is such a good prof! He makes you want to know more, he talks about current events and almost always what you're learning in class he applies to the real world! He challenges you to apply what your learning to everyday life!
it's not an easy course..needs a lot of effors..but he's a very good prof! if you like macro, take it with him!
Very interesting prof. Study his notes, don't bother reading the textbook for his exams.
Dunbar is very interested in the subject matter, which makes the lectures pretty good for econ. His exams are fair.
a lot of math in this course, if you are not good in math, then don't take him...
lots of complicated math!!!! take him IFF if u'r strong in calculas......... ok-lecture. hard exams, time-consuming assignments......... really gotta put lots of effort to get good grades. g'luck

He thinks his exams are simple.. and it's obviously not so easy. It was a lot more math than i expected - and they're very complicated one - asks you to find 2, sometimes 3, unknown variables in an equation with very little information given. A real nice and interesting prof, good to go for if you're strong in math.

He is a nice guy ... and you will for sure to get a good grade if you understand his materials from notes. However, the point is he has so much materials relating to calculous and algebra which makes it almost impossible to understand. The math part always worth 40% of his exams.If you are not the calculous kind of person, dont take it.

You couldn't ask for a better prof. Always happy to help & does his best to explain material. Excellent notes summarizing text and does his best to make the class interesting. Make sure you understand the assignments before the midterm & final!
The best econ professor I've had at SFU. High math content, but generous marker. Very approachable, helpful and seems to have a genuine interest in teaching and is passionate about economics.

The final was soooooo hard! If you are not good at number crunching then do not, I repeat, do not take his class. The math involved is too complex for me. His lectures are not bad but he gives a lots of notes! Prereq should be Econ 331!
He loves Calculus. If you are good at it, u can take him. Otherwise, avoid him and choose other profs

he is a great prof., very clear, good notes, and very helpful, however you better know your calculas if you take this class with him......exams are very simillar to assignments and his notes are sufficient to get a good grade..

Dunbar is a nice and friendly guy. However, he goes through the material too quickly and uses too much math in his lectures. He needs to give us more example so that we can associate what he is teaching us with reality. Midterm is almost all math! Better know your algebra, statistics and calculus!
Interesting lectures. Good notes. But he's some kind of calculus demon.....expectations and speed of covering the math are way beyond the prerequisite math.
worst and mean-est prof i ever had. can never have discussion or negotiation with him.  take his courses on your own risk!

this is one of the hardest econ courses...but i think he did a good job going over material slowly and clearly.  however, mt(55 avg i think...?) and final were hard...but passable if u put in the time studyin.  i dont' like the fact he doesn't curve on a grade tho...especially for a 5credit core econ course

Hard course no doubt, but his grading system makes it even harder! ***NOT CURVED*** Ex.) If average = 50%, if curved you get C+; according to his grading 50% = F. His system works IF the course is easier, but 305 is a hard course, avg on midterms will be much lower ! If Prof you are reading this, pls check your system for teaching 305!
His writing sucks ... always waste time for guessing what he is writing ... and always can't understand wht he is asking in assignment and midterm ... but he is HOT ...HANDSOME ar !
i'd recommend him just cuz his class is so dead easy you can sleep your way through a semester and pull off at least a B. it's a 5 credit course but i spent less time on it than 105.

I've taken Akbar for Econ 210 which led me to take Econ 305 a few semesters later. The guys hilarious but he is quite clear in his explanations. The first MT is usually the easiest and they do get incrementally harder. In particular, his finals are usually pretty brutal so be careful! He might be the best prof to take for 305 as well.

All exam questions were straight from the textbook.. that tells you one thing: either you need to get the solution manual to survive the course or you will need a good TA. Boring class + tons of unrealistic models introduced = I finally understand why people hate economics
His course is pretty easy and he is a nice prof!!

Even though his class is quite boring, and his writing is messy, but he is willing to help students by explaining over and over again until we truly understand. Notes are useful, attend lecture and tutorials to understand concepts!

His exam questions are very unclear. Sometimes, it seems, he does not know himself what he intended to ask, then clarifies in the midst of the exam and does not add sufficient extra time to do the question again. Still, he's relatively better than many other Profs I have experienced in the ECON department.
nice porf, easy course, go take it!
good prof!

I took akbar for 305, 355W and 387 and got A+s in all of them. Those who say he is mean and hard don't know him. The guy has lots of office hours and is friendly if you apear to put in the effort... and if you never noticed- EVERY MT AND FINAL QUESTION IS FROM THE TEXTBOOK!
EXTREMELY RUDE! shoot you down whenever you approch to him. mark very unfair and does not care about how serious this course is to econ students. does not know what he is looking for on the exams

terrible teacher. Doesn't know how to teach. Needs to learn how to speak english properly and this guy is heartless. i worked hard throughout the whole term but got nothing in return. Talked to him about how to improve. Gave me a shtty attitude and doesn't care about how his students are doing in class. Doesn't give any help AT ALL. don't take him!
i cannot understand a word that is coming out of his mouth

Horrible prof. Exam questions are not structure clear and he doesn't care. Make fun & yell at you in class. He kicked ppl out of class if they are 10 mins late at the start of the semester. Lecture are useless since he copies the text book on to the power points. Don't know his own material, SFU got another prof to teach half way into the semester.

He is a pretty good prof. tests are so easy, the answers are straight from the textbook. Marking is a bit tricky, so just be careful. final exam is very long, nobody can finish it on time. BUT he will scale for sure. Overall, his courses are pretty easy

YOU HAVE TO PAY 300% ATTENTION TO WHAT HE SAYS BECAUSE OF HIS AFRICAN (OR SOMEWHERE WORSE) ACCENT. JUST POINTLESS TO GO TO CLASS AS HE JUST READS OFF THE SLIDES WHICH IS FROM THE TEXT BOOK. BUT HE TAKES ATTENDENCE IN LECTURE. LOL
well, even though his accent causes confusion, he tries  as many students as possible to be engaged in the contents. Not really difficult,,, just convey what you r thinking to the lecture hall.
MT1 and 2 avgs were 44 and 46 respectively. Final average was 51%.

Brain is one of the best prof. ever in SFU not only because of his helpfulless, but also he always try to explain concepts in the clearest way. His midterms are more than fair and the final was a piece of cake. He gave marks aways. Take him if you have chances!
Brain is a great prof. and have been very helpful in answering questions asked. The midterms are more than fair (only 5 questions). The Final was even easier than i thought. Easy course & prof.

Course is hard no questions. But Krauth makes it even harder with unclear as to what concepts are important and every1 was surprised for MT1, even the TAs were surprised at what he put on the MT. Gone over general Cobb-Douglas version but test you on Perfect Complements. Avg MT1&2 44%.

I've only written the first midterm so far.  Immediately after completing his exam..i wanted to cry.  It was soooo HARD!  But it made me feel so much better when i found out that 90% of the class did just as BAD.  The class average was 44%!!  I did about average.  gotta see about the 2nd midter...i'll be back

Spring 2006, blame the text book it's hard with the RBC model, the prof tried to make it as easy for his students as he can.  Brian has very clear notes, knows what he is teaching, use class time very well.
Could be better.

Jus done the 2nd mid 2day, in general, this prof is pretty nice and easy, the mids are fair, i knew that his previous mids and final are based on assignment q's, but this sem totally change dued to new text. And I know that many ppl are waiting till this sem to take him, ha! the avg is low, but actually not that hard. JUST TAKE IT FOR no regret!!
Ridiculous MT, but in general he's clear about what he is talking about. Should blame the textbook for the level of difficulty. Tutorial section is a MUST, they are more informative than lectures.
Easy.
very easy overall~  studying well on lectures and practicing more problem will be very very helpful for sure.  he is nice prof willing to offer extra help before exams.  good luck...
Too easy.. Please make the material more challenging.
He is a very nice proof. His exam is very easy as well as his assignment. Just study his past exams and the assignments, you will do well in the course!
He is an insult to our intelligence.  Exam questions same as assignments.  The TAs were useless during tutorials.  The class avg was way too high and made it very very hard to get an A.

Seriously, the average for first MT was 91%. OHHHH THAT'S SOOOOO HARD! Gimme a break. And about memorizing the book, that doesn't help you any with the altered model questions. Anyhow, he's fine, not as scary as people make him out to be.
No Comments
easy homework, easy exams! but u have to love algebra!
good person but bad prof. All algebra no economics, basically all math. often screws up on his notes. AVOID THIS MAN except u love algebra and u like to read A LOT

Don't suppose to learn any Macro theory except algebra. He always thinks that he is very clear for his explanation, however, he is leading us to fall into a trap. Also, if you get the textbook's overhead, you can skip classes til final.
I DON'T LIKE HIM AT ALL!!! he MT was just WAAAAAy too long and hard...and he always made some mistakes in his notes!!! AVOID HIM!!!

His Exams are really tough(class average 45%). He is only into algebra. It's like taking a Math course. The most important thing in an exam is to be relaxed and try not to be overwhelmed by ambiguous and tricky questions.

Sometimes he doesn't look professional during the lecture scratching his head and rubbing the face but he explains the material very precisely. His true/false questions a a bit hard, you need to learn every slide from his notes and pay attention to all details. Extremely helpful in person, fair final. Overall decent prof
Heavy accent. Teaches you nothing(only read off the notes)

This course weights 5 credits, and it covers so many materials. However, if u preview notes,attend class , and do all assignments by yourself. You will be fine. Her notes are well organized, and the exam is not hard. She is always really to help, if u have any problem.
The class material is well-organized. She is very helpful. The midterm is fair.
She is so nice. The miderterm is not hard and fair. if you attend her class regularly, you will get a good mark.

If she didn't give pop quiz during lecture, there would be no students going to her lecture.                     So regret taking her lecutre, where she just read her notes without proper explanation.                   I wanna get my money back!!!!!!!!!!!!!
the worse teacher I ever have so far. She teaches u nothing.
No Comments
Great Instructor, must attend lectures to attain high grades
He's a really nice guy. I had to deal with him personally a few times and he was always accomodating. Make sure you can do the comparative statics with the models, don't worry about the math.

Yeah, his english isn't good, but its perfectly understandable. As long you pay attention in class & take good notes you'll be fine. I found the textbooks & tutorials to be purely optional - just make sure u completely understand his lecture notes. And do all his past exams. I got an relatively easy A by doing that, and I'm not even an ECON major.
Not bad. Try not to fall asleep, but don't rely soley on lectures, you have to force yourself to read this, cuz it's pretty dry. The actual prof tries, but, man.. boring.
Typical ESL grad student doing lectures. Very responsive to suggestions and questions. If you prefer algebra over calculus, take the class with him. Otherwise, stick with any of the other lecturers.

His english do need improvement, lots "and","so"... Lecture is not interesting, but still understandable. Still, his exam is relative fair. I hate too easy exams in other econ courses, that everyone got grades not depending on performance but TA. Recommand: DO practice or past exams.
Lectures weren't the greatest, but you could pick anyhting up in the text.  If you'd taken 301 before, this class was EASY.
he spends too much time lecturing on easie materials but too little time on challenging materials (like IS-LM stuff) ... overall fair exams and informative lectures.
Lectures were alright, but exams were fair and he's extremely helpful in office hours.

lectures are not that clear, he's a nice guy but just have problems getting his point through to students. exams were fair if u actually get the material however, with his teaching, u might not. stutters like porky pig once in a while..

The WORST instructor. Fails to explain his materials in class, and  gives hard midterms + finals! u need to be very good at math to pass his course.  His notes are too simple and needs elaboration!  TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!!
a nice teacher that gives out hard exams
very nice guy...
No Comments
notes are clear to me. He is very nice.
nice prof, unclear lecture
Not very good English but he's patient.His exam is from homework. Nice guy.
Lecture notes are terrible, unorganized, unclear, and hard to follow.
nice guy but bad lec notes and tough tests

Dr. Klein is very calculus-focused. Lectures consist of derivations and lots of greek letters. His teaching style is overly academic and aimed at the savants in the room. Homework assignments are difficult but that's where you learn. His exams over the years have become easier. If you ask him to explain something, he makes you feel dumb.
exams are similar with assignments and exams from previous years. Just make sure finish all samples which posted on line
very smart guy, but alot of math during lecture. assignments heavily math based. but exams are fair and much easier than assignments. If your bad with math, dont take him
Smart guy, boring teacher, cannot teach very well because he assumes you know everything. Exams are fair because they are mostly from the assignments. But overall, try to avoid this guy if you can.

Please people... he doesn't wonder off topic, and you are to learn and not to book keep... What matters is not what he writes on the board, but what lesson he teaches. Plus he gives out lecture notes. Which is more or less the same things he teaches in class, but more precise. Top notch prof.
Anything he wrote down before the midterm was formulas or some form of calculus. No words. Goes off topic with difficult material as well.
I'm still waiting for the econ portion of the class to start
boring prof, hard to follow his lectures. Most of the time, I couldn't understand what he was talking about in the lectures! I would not recommend taking courses with him.

His teaching is nonsense?... Not sure which half of the class you are talking about, but Paul is very clear. He goes slow and repeat the material just so that we get the theories and the lesson about theories. Doesn't try to cram more material into the course even having the extra time. Instead provide us with better depth. Great prof.

perhaps he is really good at economics, but his teaching is nonsense. half of the class have no idea what he's talking about..or he is assuming we should all know about this? althought his exams are ok, i will never take his course again.:(

This course is pretty tough for me, but Yan made the concepts click. He explained things super clearly and had a way of making the material actually make sense. He's lowkey one of the nicest profs I've had.

Yan is a fair professor. If you go to lecture and do the textbook practice questions you will do very well in the class. English is not is his first language so he has an accent and is sometimes hard to understand, but if you pay attention his explanations are clear and straightforward. Overall, a good professor who wants students to succeed.
I think this instructor would be the best choice for this course! Good!

He curved the class at C+, when all the other professors do at B. Especially for a upper division class. 
Only created an accnt here to prevent people to take class with him. You are better off not attending class as he will only confuse you, which kinda sucks since im paying a fortune as I am an international student. STUDY ON YOUR OWN.
Don't take this class

I had him for econ 310 and 305 and I can say he is really good. I Highley recommend taking classes with him. Make sure to go over the textbook question and understand his lectures prior to the exam. He explains concepts very clearly. if you have an interest in Monetary economics, then there is no one better to assist you with your questions.
Too hard

He is a professor you would like to go for a beer but won't like his teaching. Covers a lot of stuff. You have to work really hard and read the lecture notes thoroughly. Use book if necessary but his lecture notes are sufficient. Tough grader as he has negative marking. Makes it look easy but actually his exams are tricky and wording is vague
awesome

John he is a good professor, he is kind and always willing to help. When you go through all his lecture notes and understand what he is trying to explain you will find the examinations are not hard. Good professor that I will recommend to others.
His class is just a pain. Don't take ECON305 from him. Notes don't help and DON'T expect good marks on the exams without the text book. Literally you have to study all by yourself.

John is out to lunch. He does not explain concepts very well, and does not keep track of what he's "taught" you. His exam and assignment questions are worded in a way that is difficult to understand. Do not take this course with John. I was fortunate that I had an incredible TA.

you will need to read the text book and his lecture notes do not help, they are just  questions form the book without answer. The prof is fine but his exams are difficult. DO NOT skip his lecture! he gives pop quiz almost every class.
Such a bad prof, even the lecture is wrong. The exam makes no sense at all. Wont take his course again.
Horrible handwriting, very very terrible. Can't read his handwriting even though seating in the first row. So many mistake when he writes down the notes.

Not a good Prof.  Covers alot of material, more that most 305 classes.  Expect lecture notes to be incomplete and his test to be nothing like assigned homework questions.  We had a guest prof come in when Prof. Knowles couldnt make it and even he was criticizing his notes.  Would not recommend, while upper div econ is never easy this class was HARD

Get to know the textbook really well because he covers a lot of material really fast in lectures.  Expect the lecture notes to be riddled with errors and for the answer keys to problem sets to be wrong.  Just do a lot of independent learning and you should be fine.

If I say this is an easy A i am lying but you really have to read and understand this course. HAVE TO READ BOTH lecture sides and textbooks very very very nice Prof, he does not give you a free A you have to work for it and he is always open for questions during class and office hours.
